case_theme: Using Your Notes to Construct a Message
background: Pedro has a history of not following instructions from his mother.

dialog.text: But I’ve got to tell you something. I have an idea that your mother has written notes like that to you before, hasn’t she?
dialog.reasoning: Therapist prompts Pedro to recall past instances of similar notes from his mother.

dialog.observation: Pedro acknowledges previous notes from his mother.

dialog.text: And you still didn’t do what she asked you to do.
dialog.reasoning: Therapist highlights Pedro's past behavior of not following instructions.
Therapist points out Pedro's recent compliance with the instructions.

dialog.text: You did it today. So, that may have helped you some. But it must have been something that you did, something you did for you to make that happen.
dialog.reasoning: Therapist encourages Pedro to recognize his own agency in the positive change.

dialog.text: Ms. Smith talked to me. I had to have a conference with Ms. Smith. She told me you don’t get an education without following directions.
dialog.observation: Pedro shares the influence of Ms. Smith's advice on following directions.

dialog.text: So, you listened to Ms. Smith and it made some sense to you?
dialog.reasoning: Therapist explores Pedro's receptiveness to Ms. Smith's guidance.

dialog.observation: Pedro confirms the relevance of Ms. Smith's advice.
